Description: Ostracon, fragment of the upper-body of a brown pottery vessel, the interior is covered with a light-brown deposit, the lower section of the exterior is grooved and the whole is covered with a self-slip, remains of at least two incised Coptic letters survive.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394320) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394320)
